hypothesis_content.title: Volatility Contraction Breakout in Neutral Regime
hypothesis_content.statement: During NEUTRAL regimes, when BTC's 4-hour Bollinger Band width (100-period, 2.0 std) reaches a 20-period low (signaling compression) and is followed by a candle closing outside the bands with volume > 1.8x average, the initial breakout direction will continue as a new short-term trend for at least the next 12 periods.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Volatility compression in neutral markets represents a buildup of energy and coiling price action. A high-volume breakout from this compression often initiates a short-term directional trend as trapped positions are forced to cover and momentum traders pile in.
entry_conditions: BTC Bollinger Band Width (4H, 100, 2.0) is at a 20-period low
A 4H candle closes above the upper band (LONG) or below the lower band (SHORT)
Volume on the breakout candle > 1.8x 20-period average volume

exit_conditions.take_profit: For LONG: Price reaches the opposite Bollinger Band. For SHORT: Price reaches the opposite Bollinger Band.
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price closes back inside the Bollinger Bands

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: The probability of the price continuing in the breakout direction for 12 periods is ≤ 50%, indicating the move is more often a false breakout/fakeout.
